result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry Jamar Brown

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Michael Jude in court for Jerry Jamar Brown.  
Attorney Eric Bashirian in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Status Conference.
Defense advises the court defendant has 4 open case in 3 different courts.
Defense requesting  time to determine status of each case.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. 
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Eric Bashirian not in court. 

Case calendared for a Bail bond  Hearing. Defendant not produced due to Covid 19 issues.  
Per email from Defense Counsel  today  stating  I'm withdrawing the motion.  Mr. Brown's bail motion was denied in another case, making this motion moot.  
Matter removed from the Court's Calendared and adjourned for a Status Conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court is in receipt of defense counsel motion to adjourn 8-15-2022. Motion Granted by the Court. 
Per call with defense Bailbond hearing rescheduled to August 30, 2022 at 8:30am.
Received and Filed: Defense Motion to Adjourn 8-15-2022 Bailbond hearing.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in court by video with Attorney Michael Jude who appears in person.  Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Officer B. Ziegler. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. 
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown not in court, defendant in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Attorney Jude is out ill. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:
BRC
BKG
CLH.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jerry Jamar Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
